intro: Oxydectes macrobothrys, commonly known as the large-flowered dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces large, showy yellow flowers that develop into elongated, slender seed heads. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Oxydectes macrobothrys is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
